alert.note: Alert for Barry; Barton; Benton; Cedar; Dade; Hickory; Jasper; Lawrence; Newton; Polk; St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 7:29PM CDT until May 09 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Hickory County in central Missouri... Southeastern Barton County in southwestern Missouri... Northern Newton County in southwestern Missouri... Cedar County in southwestern Missouri... Southwestern Benton County in central Missouri... Western Polk County in southwestern Missouri... Northwestern Barry County in southwestern Missouri... Lawrence County in southwestern Missouri... St. Clair County in west central Missouri... Eastern Jasper County in southwestern Missouri... Dade County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 729 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lowry City to 6 miles south of Stockton to near Sarcoxie to near Seneca, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Carthage, Neosho, Stockton Lake, Pomme de Terre Lake, Truman Lake, Stockton State Park, Monett, Mount Vernon, El Dorado Springs, Granby, Stockton, Greenfield, Sarcoxie, Pierce City, Appleton City, Duenweg, Humansville, Osceola, Lockwood and Diamond. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 12 and 58. Interstate 49 between mile markers 23 and 42, and between mile markers 45 and 48. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Barry; Barton; Benton; Cedar; Dade; Hickory; Jasper; Lawrence; Newton; Polk; St. Clair
